frameDefinitions: In this frame an Action is evaluated with respect to how fairly, justly or equitably the Action affects the Affected_party.
The Behavior of an Evaluee is described in terms of the reaction it deserves from somebody, such as praise, blame or admiration.
This frame concerns an Evaluee being judged for its quality, i.e. how much it would probably be liked.
The words in this frame describe an Experiencer's emotions with respect to some Content.
An Importer receives Goods from an Exporting_area, across a boundary or border to a different area, the Importing_area.
In this frame either a Stimulus brings about a particular emotion or experience in the Experiencer or  saliently fails to bring about a particular experience.
frameExamples: Smithers was being very <t>fair</t> about the distribution of supplies.
It was <t>honorable</t> of you to help that person.
My <t>enjoyment</t> of the movie was considerably impaired by the seven-foot guy sitting in front of me.
The U.S. <t>imported</t> some wheat in the period, although it exported about ten times as much.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Actor</fen> is the individual who performs the <fen>Action</fen> and can thus be characterized with repsect to how that <fen>Action</fen> affects the <fen>Affected_party</fen>.
The <fen>Action</fen> is judged based on how just and appopriate it is to the <fen>Affected_party</fen> in a particular situation.
The <fen>Grounds</fen> is the event or state that requires some decision or action in response to it for which the <fen>Actor</fen> is judged.
The <fen>Affected_party</fen>'s treatment is what determines the evaluation of the <fen>Actor</fen>'s <fen>Action</fen>.
The <fen>Behavior</fen> of the <fen>Evaluee</fen> is being judged as worthy of a particular reaction.
This role indicates the <fen>Behavior</fen> on which the assessment of praiseworthiness is based.
The <fen>Evaluee</fen> is being judged for its quality.
This role marks expressions that denote a scalar property of the <fen>Evaluee</fen> with respect to which the <fen>Evaluee</fen> is judged.
The <fen>Experiencer</fen> experiences the emotion or other internal state.

<fen>Content</fen> is what the <fen>Experiencer</fen>'s feelings or experiences are directed towards or based upon.  The <fen>Content</fen> differs from a stimulus because the <fen>Content</fen> is not construed as being direcly responsible for causing the emotion.

The Frame Element <fen>Expressor</fen> marks expressions that indicate a body part, gesture or other expression of the <fen>Experiencer</fen> that reflect his or her emotional state.  They describe a presentation of the experience or emotion denoted by the adjective or noun.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the area about which the <fen>Experiencer</fen> has the particular experience.
The <fen>State</fen> is the abstract noun that describes a more lasting experience by the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.
The <fen>Event</fen> is the occasion or happening that <fen>Experiencer</fen>s in a certain emotional state participate in.
The time at which the <fen>Experiencer</fen> is in the specified emotional state.
The conscious entity, generally a person, that brings the <fen>Goods</fen> into the <fen>Importing_area</fen>.
The items of value whose location is changing.
The role <fen>Importing_area</fen> is the place that the <fen>Goods</fen> end up as a result of motion.
The place where the <fen>Goods</fen> are initially, before the being moved.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>Importer</fen> moves the <fen>Goods</fen>.
The <fen>Stimulus</fen> is the object or event which brings about the emotion in the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.
listRoleExamples: It was commendable <fex>of Lisa</fex> to give so much to charity.
The Beaujolais Nouveau is dazzling <fex>in freshness</fex>.
The delight <fex>on her face</fex> was mixed with asonishment.
Mr. Whiskers was upset <fex>about his cat treats</fex>.
It felt pretty awkward to partake in such a nervous <fex>ceremony</fex>.
<fex>Last year</fex>, Bob was still interested in the young Republicans.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: the QuebecResolution of the Fathers of Confederation
